Name: Broad collar
Description: This broad collar is made of multicoloured glazed faience beads covered with gold foil to enhance the worth of this piece of jewellery, worn by the deceased. It consists of four rows of long tubular beads, small circular beads separate the rows at top and bottom; the lower border is made up of drop-shaped pendants (yellow, with a green dot at the lower wide end). The ends were held together by two semicircular endpieces made of light blue glazed faience covered with gold foil. The counterpoise is made from a smaller semicircular piece of faience and tubular, round and drop-shaped beads.
